alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Bledsoe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 6:46PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST/9 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Bledsoe, Hamilton, Loudon, McMinn, Meigs, Morgan, Rhea and Roane. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST /900 PM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM EST /646 PM CST/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oak Ridge, Lenoir City, Dayton, Kingston, Rockwood, Loudon, Decatur, Fairview, Oliver Springs, Spring City, Midtown, Harriman, Graysville, Peakland, Ten Mile, Eagle Furnace, Grandview, Piney Falls State Park, Stinging Fork Falls State Park and Paint Rock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
